context: The word 'räägi' is an imperative form meaning 'speak!' or 'talk!' It is the second-person singular present imperative of the verb 'rääkima' (to speak, to talk). In Estonian grammar, imperatives are used to give direct commands. The word appears in contexts like telling someone to speak louder ('Räägi valjemini') or addressing someone directly ('Kuule, räägi mis sul on plaanis').
